Interface BuildingManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BuildingManager

    public interface BuildingManagerInterface
    Interface for the BuildingManager class for CS103, Project 7, FALL 2013 Contains an ArrayList of objects that inherit from the Abstract class Building Keeps track of the number of Houses, Stores, Churches/Schools, and Other Buildings
    Author:
    Professor Myers modified by Professor Justh

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBuilding(int code, java.lang.String street, double assess, int buildNum, double gross)
      Add a building to the ArrayList.
      double calculateTotalTax()
      Calculate the total tax for all buildings in the ArrayList
      java.lang.String generateTaxReport()
      Generates a tax report of revenue from buildings Building are listed in ascending order by building number
      Building getFirstBuilding()
      Returns the first building in the ArrayList for testing purposes
      int getNumCommunity()
      Returns the number of Community buildings (churches and schools) in the ArrayList
      int getNumHouse()
      Returns the number of houses in the ArrayList
      int getNumOtherBuilding()
      Returns the number of other buildings in the ArrayList
      int getNumStore()
      Returns the number of stores in the ArrayList
      void sort()
      Sort the objects by building Number Use one of the methods in your SortBuildingArrayList class The SortBuildingArrayList class is a modified version of the SortBuildingArray class given you.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Creates a string representation of the object

    • Method Detail

      • addBuilding

        void addBuilding(int code,
               java.lang.String street,
               double assess,
               int buildNum,
               double gross)
        Add a building to the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        code - Type of building: 1-house, 2-store, 3-church/school, 4-other building
        street - address
        assess - assessment in 1000's
        buildNum - building number

      • sort

        void sort()
        Sort the objects by building Number Use one of the methods in your SortBuildingArrayList class The SortBuildingArrayList class is a modified version of the SortBuildingArray class given you.

      • generateTaxReport

        java.lang.String generateTaxReport()
        Generates a tax report of revenue from buildings Building are listed in ascending order by building number
        Returns:
        String that contains the Tax Report
